  physical_appearance: This is a painting of the artist\u0027s depiction of the prelude of the attack on Pangkor Island by Force 136. It features a scene on the foreground
 with a portrait of a man blended into the background on the top right. There are several boats approaching the shore on the left
 with groups of armies gathered in the center of the painting. There is an inscription above the painting. The painting is presented on a long vertical scroll.

  sgcool_label_text: This drawing belongs to part of a collection of artefacts related to the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136. The collection of materials was gathered by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012)
 who was a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee
 which date from mid 1990s to early 2000s.\r\n\r\nForce 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerrillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya. \r\n\r\nThis painting depicts the prelude to the attack at Pangkor Island by Force 136 and is executed from memory by Tan Chong Tee.

metadata.title_text: Prelude to Attack at Pangkor Island
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a painting of the artist's depiction of the prelude of the attack on Pangkor Island by Force 136. It features a scene on the foreground, with a portrait of a man blended into the background on the top right. There are several boats approaching the shore on the left, with groups of armies gathered in the center of the painting. There is an inscription above the painting. The painting is presented on a long vertical scroll.

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This drawing belongs to part of a collection of artefacts related to the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136. The collection of materials was gathered by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012), who was a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee, which date from mid 1990s to early 2000s.

Force 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerrillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya. 

This painting depicts the prelude to the attack at Pangkor Island by Force 136 and is executed from memory by Tan Chong Tee.
